file_insights.changes: Comprehensive update of experiment results across 7 micro-experiments
key_updates: Updated overall project status to completed
Added actual benchmark results for each experiment
Updated go/no-go decisions for each experiment

patterns_discovered: Performance benchmarking strategy for technical indicators
Systematic experiment evaluation using consistent decision criteria
Hybrid algorithm design based on empirical performance measurements
gotchas_discovered: Kernel fusion doesn't always improve performance
Memory bandwidth and computational overhead can negate expected gains
Algorithmic complexity varies significantly with input size and parameters

key_findings: Separate implementations often faster than fused kernels
Deque-based algorithms show significant speedup for large periods

recommendations: Keep separate implementations for EMAs and running statistics
Implement hybrid deque-based algorithm with period-dependent switching
Prioritize algorithmic simplicity over complex fusion techniques
